climbs.name: Phantom
climbs.fa: Evan Mathews, Equiped by Alex Wakeman 2013

content.description: This steep route traverses the large horizontal crack directly above the Rain Cave. Tread lightly through yellow rock on the left side of the cave past three bolts to a small ledge. From here follow the crack right through great black rock on awesome crimps, jugs, and slopers. Follow the crack through the roof to it's end, clipping a long grey fixed chain. From here, fire off a technical and powerful crux above the intimidating lip and crimp your way up the slab past two bolts to chains. 9 bolts
content.protection: Quickdraws and a few alpine draws for the bottom of the route. Chain anchors.
content.location: The Rain Cave. The cave is located at the top of the talus field between the Lower and Upper Replica.

content.description: An interesting looking route that makes it's way up the right hand side of the cave to the nice blue slab to a crack. You might want to extend the draw underneath the big undercling 25ft up. Due to hollow rock the bolt had to be placed to the left. **bolts
content.location:
The Rain Cave

The cave is located at the top of the talus field between the Lower and Upper Replica
